thread.title: U.S. Team Wins Presidents Cup on Final Hole
thread.title_full: U.S. Team Wins Presidents Cup on Final Hole - WSJ

author: wsjcom
title: U.S. Team Wins Presidents Cup on Final Hole
text:
0 COMMENTS INCHEON, South Korea—The U.S. held off an inspired rally Sunday to win the Presidents Cup for the sixth straight time, this one decided by the final match.
The Americans got the winning point from Bill Haas, the son of U.S. captain Jay Haas, who won 2-up over an emotionally distraught Bae Sang-moon, of South Korea. Bae needed to win the final hole for the International team to share the cup, but he stubbed a chip.
ENLARGE Bill Haas plays his second shot at the 11th hole on Sunday. Photo: Getty Images The Americans won 15 1/2 to 14 1/2—the closest result in years.
The tense final session was just what this competition needed , though it didn’t feel that way to the International team. It looked like the International team had control until America’s Chris Kirk holed a 15-foot putt on the 18th, and India’s Anirban Lahiri lost the hole by missing a 4-foot putt.
